data.title: Lennon’s donation and roses to the Clyde shipbuilders 1971 UCS work
data.meta_description: The full story behind John Lennon and Yoko Ono’s donation to Clyde Shipbuilders of the UCS as he went from Beatle to political and peace activist.
data.text:
Yoko Ono was born in Tokyo, Japan, on 18 February 1933 to Isoko and Eisuke Ono.

Her father, Eisuke – a former classical pianist – was a wealthy banker.

Both parents came from wealthy Japanese families.

Read the full blog: The Beatle, The Bankie & The Bouquet .

The full story behind John Lennon and Yoko Ono’s donation to Clyde shipbuilders of the UCS in 1971 as he went from Beatle to political and peace activist.
